content.question: A weight suspended by a spring vibrates vertically according to the function <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> given by <math alttext="D of t, equals, 2 times the sine of, open parenthesis, 4 pi, times, open parenthesis, t plus one eighth, close parenthesis, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo symmetric="false">(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo symmetric="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo symmetric="false">)</mo></mrow><mo symmetric="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="D of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, in centimeters, is the directed distance of the weight from its central position <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds after the start of the motion. Assume the positive direction is upward. What is the instantaneous rate of change of the weight’s position, in centimeters per second, at the moment the weight is first 1 centimeter above its central position?

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
